registry.title: IPv4 Multicast Address Space Registry
registry.note:
Host Extensions for IP Multicasting specifies the extensions required of a host implementation of the Internet Protocol (IP) to support multicasting. The multicast addresses are in the range 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255. Address assignments are listed below.
The range of addresses between 224.0.0.0 and 224.0.0.255, inclusive, is reserved for the use of routing protocols and other low-level topology discovery or maintenance protocols, such as gateway discovery and group membership reporting. Multicast routers should not forward any multicast datagram with destination addresses in this range, regardless of its TTL.

registry.title: Local Network Control Block (224.0.0.0 - 224.0.0.255 (224.0.0/24))
registry.registration_rule: Expert Review, IESG Approval, or Standards Action
registry.note: (*) It is only appropriate to use these values in explicitly- configured experiments; they MUST NOT be shipped as defaults in implementations. See for details.

registry.title: Internetwork Control Block (224.0.1.0 - 224.0.1.255 (224.0.1/24))
registry.registration_rule: Expert Review, IESG Approval, or Standards Action

registry.title: AD-HOC Block I (224.0.2.0 - 224.0.255.255)
registry.registration_rule: Expert Review, IESG Approval, or Standards Action

registry.title: RESERVED (224.1.0.0-224.1.255.255 (224.1/16))
registry.note: No new assignments are being made in this range for the time being.

registry.title: AD-HOC Block II (224.3.0.0-224.4.255.255 (224.3/16, 224.4/16))
registry.registration_rule: Expert Review, IESG Approval, or Standards Action

registry.title: Source-Specific Multicast Block (232.0.0.0-232.255.255.255 (232/8))
registry.note: Addresses within the 232.0.1.0-232.255.255.255 are dynamically allocated by hosts when needed

registry.title: AD-HOC Block III (233.252.0.0-233.255.255.255 (233.252/14))
registry.registration_rule: Expert Review, IESG Approval, or Standards Action

registry.title: Relative Addresses used with Scoped Multicast Addresses
registry.note:
(*) It is only appropriate to use these values in explicitly- configured experiments; they MUST NOT be shipped as defaults in implementations. See for details.
These addresses are listed in the Domain Name Service under MCAST.NET and 224.IN-ADDR.ARPA.
Note that when used on an Ethernet or IEEE 802 network, the 23 low-order bits of the IP Multicast address are placed in the low-order 23 bits of the Ethernet or IEEE 802 net multicast address 1.0.94.0.0.0. See the section on "IANA ETHERNET ADDRESS BLOCK".

record.description: Reserved - To be assigned by the IANA
Reserved - To be assigned by the IANA
